sec.p: After carrying out the risk assessment and the actions described in paragraph A.3, a Plan for the prevention and management of harassment at work should be implemented, evaluating the work environments also with respect to any sexist attitudes, behaviours or situations of lack of respect that may have occurred.
To identify the most effective preventive actions to be taken, the conditions of the workplace, the organizational context, the type of user, the activities and services provided should be assessed.

The organization can set up a "Working Group", which includes, for example, the company management and the personnel most at risk to allow the identification and implementation of actions and measures necessary to ensure program effectiveness
Possible actions that can be implemented are:

1. Structural and technological measures: e.g., installation of alarm systems, suitable lighting systems, systems for entering access codes to limit the entry of strangers to workplaces, maintenance of good condition of structures and equipment.
2. Organizational measures: interviews with all parties involved, and analysis of the cases that have occurred
3. Management of episodes of violence: data collection, event recording, analysis of the events that have occurred
4. Psychological management of episodes of violence: support activities for workers/planners, use of professionals
